Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2013 10:36AM bmaybee67 wrote: Hi Karen, I just had my port replaced a couple weeks ago.  It had not been not working well for sometime and the Dye test showed I had a blood clot.  It was a easy surgery and I had an infusion a week after and it worked GREAT!   I had forgot how nice a port  was that workd correctly! Good Luck!  Barbie

Posts.Title: Hospice for me. Chickadee Jac53

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2012 01:28PM bmaybee67 wrote: I was stage Iv from the start with one single met to the sternum.  I had my ovaries removed and the tumors practically disolved in just 3 months.  The doctors were impressed and we then started a very agressive treatment and now I am NED and take only zometa and femara. I think the taking the ovaries out saved my life.  Yes, the side effects are horrible, but if it gives me more time, then so be it.  Good luck, Barbie

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2013 01:10PM bmaybee67 wrote: Hi went on disability during chemo and took the next three years off work.  It was the best thing I did.  I spent time taking care of me and having time with my children.  I was approved right away.  I did go back to work on the ticket program, I just completed my 9th month and loose by benefits next month.  I can have them expedited for the next two years if I cannot continue to work.  Someday are great other days I just want to give up.  The main thing I have noticed is my memory is awful and I have trouble learning new things.  I am very happy I tried the ticket program.
